ClsC_c72b3bea.class_description: Protective or magical objects placed in ancient Egyptian burials to aid and protect the deceased in the afterlife.
ClsC_c72b3bea.evidence_excerpt: Protective ritual objects included in burials for afterlife protection.

members.entity_description: Protective or magical objects placed in ancient Egyptian burials to aid and protect the deceased in the afterlife.
members.resolution_context: Both entries describe the same concept of protective ritual objects included in burials for afterlife protection, differing only slightly in wording and type_hint granularity.

ClsC_ee35b597.class_description: Supreme monarchs who governed ancient Egypt and for whom monumental tombs, such as pyramids, were constructed as burial places.
ClsC_ee35b597.evidence_excerpt: monumental structures were built to house the pharaohs and other important individuals in the afterlife

members.entity_description: Rulers of ancient Egypt for whom monumental tombs like pyramids were constructed.
members.resolution_context: These monumental structures were built to house the pharaohs and other important individuals in the afterlife.

ClsC_97fcc83a.class_description: Rooms or enclosed spaces designed to house mummified bodies along with religious texts, amulets, and other provisions for the journey to the afterlife in ancient Egyptian mortuary contexts.
ClsC_97fcc83a.evidence_excerpt: Room or space in which the mummified deceased, texts, and amulets were placed.

members.entity_description: Room or space in which the mummified deceased, texts, and amulets were placed.
members.resolution_context: To ensure this reunion, the Egyptians included a variety of religious texts and amulets in the burial chamber to guide the deceased on their journey to the afterlife. The burial chamber housed the preserved body as well as the objects meant to support the soulâ€™s passage beyond death.

ClsC_90fa6ada.class_description: Papyrus-based scrolls or sheets used as writing supports, particularly for inscribing religious or funerary texts such as the Book of the Dead.
ClsC_90fa6ada.evidence_excerpt: The Book of the Dead was often inscribed on papyrus scrolls and placed in the tomb.

members.entity_description: Papyrus-based writing material used to inscribe the Book of the Dead.
members.resolution_context: The Book of the Dead was often inscribed on papyrus scrolls and placed in the tomb with the deceased.
